newsitem.title: FINLAND: SANTASALO SEES FIM 25 MLN RESHUFFLE COST.
newsitem.headline: SANTASALO SEES FIM 25 MLN RESHUFFLE COST.

text.p: Finnish engineering group Santasalo-JOT Oy said on Wednesday it would book 25 million markka extra costs from a planned reshuffle of cast operations, which are expected to lead to 25 million markka annual gains.

"Extraordinary costs of at most 25 million markka will be booked in the first tertial of 1997 from the closure of UPO Valimo," Santasalo said in a statement, adding that synergy benefits from the reorganisation will affect 1998 earnings.
Santasalo said it plans to transfer casting production from its loss-making UPO Valimo in Lahti to the group's other casting units in Karkkila, Pietarsaari, Pori and Iisalmi.
UPO Valimo is one of the units Santasalo acquired from furniture and plastic pipes group Asko Oy in February.
Santasalo also said it plans to invest 25 million markka to modernise production at the Pietarsaari and Karkkila units.
